doc:
Angela Bettis https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angela_Bettis 0 Angela Marie Bettis (born January 9, 1973) is an American film and stage actress, film producer, and director best known for her lead roles in the 2002 TV adaptation of the Stephen King novel Carrie, the title character in May (2002), and in Girl, Interrupted as an anorexic psychiatric patient Janet Webber. In addition to her work in film, Bettis also starred in two Broadway productions: The Father in 1996 with Frank Langella, and as Abigail Williams in a 2002 revival of Arthur Miller's The Crucible alongside Liam Neeson and Laura Linney. Angela_Marie_Bettis ( born January_9_,_1973 ) is an_American_film_and_stage_actress , film_producer , and director best_known for her_lead_roles in the_2002_TV_adaptation of the_Stephen_King_novel_Carrie , the_title_character in May ( 2002 ) , and in Girl , Interrupted as an_anorexic_psychiatric_patient_Janet_Webber . In addition to her_work in film , Bettis also starred in two_Broadway_productions : The_Father in 1996 with Frank_Langella , and as Abigail_Williams in a_2002_revival of Arthur_Miller 's_The_Crucible alongside Liam_Neeson and Laura_Linney .
